metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2236 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel io_uring subsystem can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Both io_install_fixed_file and its callers call fput in a file in case of an error, causing a reference underflow which leads to a use-after-free vulnerability. We recommend upgrading past commit 9d94c04c0db024922e886c9fd429659f22f48ea4.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1005-aws - 5.13.0-1005.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-aws - 6.2.0-1005.5~22.04.1
No subscription required
